instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the quantitative analysis models for the simultaneous quantitative analysis of Escherichia coli, Staphylococcus aureus, and Salmonella typhimurium and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the quantitative analysis models in this study was the coefficient of determination (R2) and the root mean square error (RMSE). The R2 value measures the proportion of the variance in the predicted concentrations that can be explained by the model, with a value closer to 1 indicating a better fit. The RMSE value represents the average difference between the predicted and actual concentrations, with a lower value indicating higher accuracy.

The text does not provide information on how far this metric can go in terms of its range or limitations.

instruction: What is the advantage of using partial least squares regression (PLSR) and artificial neural networks (ANNs) in the quantitative analysis models developed for the label-free SERS technique?
